availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The Commonwealth of Kentucky to the Sheriff of Adair County; you are again commanded to summon Dewit C Miller & Aaron H Rice -- to appear in the Adair Circuit Court on the first day of its next May term to show cause why Judgment should not be rendered against them for the sum of Two hundred & fifty Dollars on account of the forfeiture of the recognizance acknowledged by them for the appearance of said Dewit C Miller in said Court to answer an Indictment found against him in said court and have then there this writ. with due return how you have executed it. --
Given under my hand as clerk of said Court this 27th day of February 1864

James T. Page
A Copy Test James T. Page C. A. C. C

Copy sums on forftd Recogn
Remit forfeiture
Tho E Bramlette

Adair Cir Ct
vs
Miller & Rice
$250-
Forfeiture
9th Apl/ 64
